The line $y - x \sqrt{3} + 3 = 0$ intersects the parabola $2y^2 = 2x + 3$ at points $A$ and $B.$  Let $P = (\sqrt{3},0).$  Find $|AP - BP|.$
inference:
Solving the system of equations
\begin{align*}
y - x \sqrt{3} + 3 &= 0, \\
2y^2 &= 2x + 3,
\end{align*}we get $x = 1$ and $x = \frac{1}{2},$ so the points of intersection are $A = (1, \sqrt{3} - 3)$ and $B = \left( \frac{1}{2}, \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2} - \frac{3}{2} \right).$  Then
\begin{align*}
AP &= \sqrt{(1 - \sqrt{3})^2 + (\sqrt{3} - 3)^2} = \sqrt{12 - 8 \sqrt{3}}, \\
BP &= \sqrt{\left( \frac{1}{2} - \sqrt{3} \right)^2 + \left( \frac{\sqrt{3}}{2} - \frac{3}{2} \right)^2} = \sqrt{6 - 4 \sqrt{3}}.
\end{align*}Hence,
\[|AP - BP| = \sqrt{12 - 8 \sqrt{3}} - \sqrt{6 - 4 \sqrt{3}} = \boxed{\sqrt{3} - 1}.\]
